Name: Sitting Statue of a King
Description: This statue portrays a king seated on a low-backed chair and resting one hand flat on his knee while holding a folded cloth in the other. He wears the Nemes headdress and the pleated Shendyt kilt. The ceremonial beard, symbol of his royal dignity, is attached to his chin. The whole statue is painted in red. The uraeus, or royal cobra, is missing and the beard is partly broken. Signs of erosion are visible on the whole statue.
